item.title: 12cm Rail For Modular Tool Rail System
item.description:
I had issues with the Rail Warping when I printed it, so I made a shorter one. I also made the base a little thinner to save on plastic since I won't be putting much weight on this.

I would like the thank the original designer for publishing their fusion files.

support tourniquet pour 6 grand verres a pied

item.title: US to EU Pipe Adapter
item.description:
A friend needed a way to attach an european pipe to an american pipe, so I designed this part for my friend.

We can generate any fitting by just measuring the outer diameter of both pipes.

Requires 5x3mm magnets

covers the lcd so you aren't blinded by the light
item.author: Kenopy

item.title: Boyueda Laotie Janobike Langfeite Footrest Long version
item.description:
Boyueda Laotie Janobike Langfeite Footrest. This is V2 longer version. Great for bigger riders. Print on the side using PetG (reccomended) or PLA.
It helps a lot to keep balance during aggressive ride and is much more convenient than placing foot on standard mudguard support. For handle strength use additional hex screw. M10 100mm with washer and nut will be fine.

My previous shorter version:
https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4805715
item.author: MakoFPV

item.title: Lowrider 2 Dust Shoe
item.description:
Dust Shoe created by SpaceGrey https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3605877 in sketchup, also done in real as shown in photos.

item.author: tcatca

item.title: Lambeau Field
item.description:
Remix of a Packer's phone case. This is a model of Lambeau field. The field on a nice stand. No supports required. I printed at 20% infill and 0.12 mm layer height.

Please like and post any makes!

Lambeau Field
Lambeau Field model
model Lambeau field
Packers
Green Bay Packers
Do not sell this model in any way shape or form, please.
item.author: MrN1ck

item.title: model airplane hanger
item.description: this was created to hang model airplanes from under a shelf. The part has been tested with 1/72 & 1/48 scale planes, using 'invisible thread' tied to the aircraft then looped over the two end pillars.
item.author: AndyMoore_1

item.title: Dosenpresse
item.description: Dosenpresse
item.author: Franzist

item.title: Optical Sensor Endstop for Kossel Printer
item.description:
This is an optical sensor endstop mount system I made for my Kossel printer. I used the default hardware to install it. I believe they are M4 x 8 bolts and T nuts for rails.

The blocker post mounts with my 4 Wheel Carriage I made using M3 x 6mm button head bolts. Mounting holes are spaced 26mm apart.

The carriage can be found here: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:5220984

Here is the sensors I used: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07MFT8NWJ/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o07_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1
item.author: Mute916

item.title: Countertop shelf
item.description:
Small stackable shelf. Uses 5mm dowels.

There are three (3) files: bottom, mid, and top. Mid and top can stack on top of bottom, so you can make it as tall as you like. In my application I used three stories and it's very stable.

You can use glue to secure the dowels to the sides, but I found it not to be necessary.
The holes for the dowels are 6mm diameter, as I found 5mm dowels are actually larger than 5mm.
item.author: zvoniimiir

item.title: Book Raiser
item.description:
A basic shelf to raise books in a bookshelf. Default size, in cm: 12x12x7.

The supports not being near the edge allow for small printing mistakes.
item.author: Maximelene

item.title: Aerogarden grow basket adapter for Gardyn yPod
item.description:
Now you can use the Aerogarden Grow Baskets/pods with the Gardyn using the adapter. It fits right into the Gardyn yPod.

Have a nice day!
item.author: Mswelsh

item.title: SKADIS Apple Watch Hanger
item.description:
This is a Apple Watch Hanger for the IKEA SKARDIS wall board. The charging cable does smoothly fit into the channel and the hole for the magnetic charger is just right to have a tight fit. This is the perfect place for the watch to charge and not to laying around on the desk.
You'll have to use supports in order to get the hook properly into it.
item.author: m48u

item.title: EBL Smart Battery Charger Wall Mount
item.description:
Needed a little wall mount for my EBL battery charger, this does the job nicely, bit of a niche item as I don't think these are on sale anymore but all the same!

Didn't need any supports, used a brim just to be on the safe side.
item.author: thehumanshield

item.title: Dog Lock to Make a Cat Room
item.description:
This is a door lock that cracks the door just enough so that a cat can comfortably enter a room without a dog following him or her.

The nice thing about this lock is that it doesn't require drilling. It may scratch your door some. If that is not acceptable than I suggest tapping the area where it contacts the door.

Another nice feature is that it is self locking. When you shut the door the latch is angled so that it props right into the lock pit of the door frame. At first install this might not be possible, but given some time to stretch, it will form to a state of self latching.

I have found that a PLA such as PLA+ that has good mechanical properties works best. If you use a poor or weathered PLA it may crack down the road with time.

Enjoy! Your cats will love their privacy.
item.author: CapnMuff

item.title: Allah Frame
item.description: This is a remix of https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4360081 . Add a square base on the word Allah so that it can be easily frame it and hang it on wall.
item.author: Qhairizad

item.title: Ender Camera Mount 1/4''
item.description: This is a camera mount for an Ender 3 with a 1/4th inch screw for standard camera mounts. It pivots out of the way when needed.
item.author: foxpotat0

item.title: ROCK64 Case
item.description:
Remix of JCRona's case at https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:2767191, just swaping out the honeycomb for the pine64 logo

This case fits a ROCK64 board and gives access to all the various required ports and slots.

Uses four M2.5-0.45x20mm screws
item.author: scottbot02

item.title: Tuba valve cap extender
item.description:
This is an extender sleeve for a Miraphone 186 CC tuba rotary valve. It screws onto the bottom of the valve and provides space for an Apple AirTag(TM) between the bottom of the valve and the screw on bottom cap.

It prints in two parts. The first has an internal thread that screws onto the valve body. The second has an external thread to accommodate the existing nickel-silver valve bottom cap. The second piece slides into the first and can be glued in place with any CA glue.

I sanded the exterior, applied some primer and spray painted it in a metallic brass color.

The threads are metric .7mm pitch and are quite fine. I was frankly surprised that my AnyCubic Vyper was able to successfully print this fine pitch. The threads don't turn out well if they are on the bottom in contact with the printer bed. Hence the two pieces so each can be printed with the threaded section at the top.

I find that I get some shrinkage using the MatterHackers PLA Pro and had to adjust the diameters by trial and error until they fit the existing metal parts. I expect that there may be fitting issues requiring adjustment when printed on another printer or using different filament.

The photos show it mounted to the 5th valve on my tuba as its bottom cap is actually on top allowing for a clear photo. In practice, I expect most people will prefer to install it on one of the other valves where it is almost unnoticeable.
item.author: retiredtuba

item.title: 4 wheel Kossel Belt Carriage
item.description:
Optical Sensor Mount and post: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:5221000

I was having an issue where the 3 wheel belt carriage was twisting with a flying extruder. I created this to solve the issue and have more stability. This was on a MicroMake D1 Kossel printer. I used all the factory hardware and added a few more to complete the setup.

Stock belt holder holes in the middle of the carriage are 20mm x 20mm apart in case you want to measure yours and see if it will fit. You can also do 20mm x 30mm or 20mm x 50mm with this option.

You can get the most the parts from Home Depot. Here is what is needs to complete:

Note** The M3 nuts for the tensioner part are really tight to make sure they don't spin. They will need to be pressed in.

3 - M5 x 25 bolt (Can use 30mm long also) (For wheels)

3 - M5 Nut (For Wheels)

Poly wheels from Amazon - https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08QTPCGMR/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s02?ie=UTF8&psc=1

3 - M3 x 12 bolt (For stock belt holder) (Or just use the factory 3 bolts it came with)

6 - M3 x 12 bolt (For the tensioner on the side)

6 - M3 nuts (for the tensioner on the side)

Printed this using supports touching build plate with PETG @ 250
item.author: Mute916

item.title: 40mm Fan Pi Case Part
item.description: Remixed it to fit a 40mm fan
item.author: mvfarmer

item.title: Spectra 5" TV Model 58-MBWR Modular Chassis
item.description:
3D files for printing your own 5" CRT chassis like I did.

The TV is pretty easy to find on eBay: Spectra Model 58-MBWR

Using 3" cabinet pulls for the front. You need 1.5" size 8 screws to attach the pulls (longer than the screws it comes with)

Size 8 threaded rod and nuts.

For the card-edge interface I have included the Eagle files as well as the Gerber files in a zip.
item.author: benheck

item.title: Realsteady session holder for xl5
item.description:
This is gopro session 5 holder that work with realsteady and has ND filter holder. I couldn't find something similar, so I took the model of ScorpionTDL and modify it for my frame, the iflight XL5 V5.

You should print it on the side, and add some supports (but not everywhere, supports are useless for the smallest holes)

item.title: Camera Adapter (1/4") for Moobs or else
item.description:
Simple adapter to attach a camera or else with a 1/4" thread one a broomstick.
The dimensions of the threads are in one picture.
Designt to fit a 1/4" - 20 UNC x 3/4" screw, but you can change the dimensions.

item.title: HotEndCover for Anycubic Mega X
item.description:
HotEndCover for the Anycubic Mega-X

Time to print: ~2h

Filament: PLA ICE FILAMENTS Fluo Gnarly Green

Schichtdicke: 0,2mm
Wanddicke: 1,2mm
Drucktemperatr: 200°C

item.title: Butée Bras Extrudeur Sidewinder X2
item.description:
Butée de Bras d'extrudeur pour Sidewinder X2

Cette petite butée empêche le Bras d'extrudeur de votre Sidewinder X2 de se tordre et de bloquer votre filament.

Il faut l’enfoncer comme sur la photo c'est tout !

Bonne utilisation.

By Francky
aamania@aol.com
item.author: Franck13
